subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is better to be patient than powerful; it is better have self control than to conquer a city. (Proverbs 16:32)
reflection: Self-control is superior to conquest. Success in business, school, or home life can be ruined by a person who loses control of his or her temper. So it is a great personal victory to control your temper. When you feel yourself ready to explode, remember that losing control may cause you to forfeit what you want most.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remember to look to You each day for greater patients, when I feel the urge to explode. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is better to be patient than powerful; it is better have self_

_control than to conquer a city. _(Pro 16:32)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Self-control is superior to conquest. Success in business, school,

or home life can be ruined by a person who loses control of his or

her temper. So it is a great personal victory to control your temper.

When you feel yourself ready to explode, remember that losing control

may cause you to forfeit what you want most.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remember to look to You each

day for greater patients, when I feel the urge to explode. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: A dry crust eaten in peace is better than a great feast with strife. (Proverbs 17:1)
reflection: Which would you sooner have, a bowl of soup with someone you love, or a steak with someone you hate? What God wants from us is to build on a foundation of love! ! !
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to build on a foundation of love so that no mater what I eat or who I eat is with I will feel I have been blest by You. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A dry crust eaten in peace is better than a great feast with
strife._

(Pro 17:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Which would you sooner have, a bowl of soup with someone you

love, or a steak with someone you hate? What God wants from us

is to build on a foundation of love! ! !

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to build on a foundation of love

so that no mater what I eat or who I eat is with I will feel I have

been blest by You. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who acts shamefully. (Proverbs 17:2)
reflection: A wise servant could be given authority and even freed by his master. Servants in the ancient world often had oversight over young heirs, and might even inherit a masters estate in the absence of a biological son. What this proverb cautions is not to always rely on privilege and position.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that my behavior will always be pleasing to You. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who acts_

_shamefully. _(Pro. 17:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A wise servant could be given authority and even freed by

his master. Servants in the ancient world often had oversight

over young heirs, and might even inherit a masters estate in

the absence of a biological son. What this proverb cautions

is not to always rely on privilege and position.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that my behavior will always be pleasing

to You. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the Lord tests the heart. (Proverbs 17:3)
reflection: It takes intense heat to purify gold and silver. Similarly it takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be purified. through trials. By them God shows us what is in us and clears out anything that gets in the way of complete trust in Him. So when tough times come our way, realize that God wants to use them to refine your faith and purify your heart.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to understand what you are trying to tell me when trials come my way. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the Lord_

_tests the heart. _(Pro. 17:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It takes intense heat to purify gold and silver. Similarly it

takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be purified. through

trials. By them God shows us what is in us and clears out anything that gets in the way of complete trust in Him. So when

tough times come our way, realize that God wants to use them

to refine your faith and purify your heart.

PRAYER FOR TODAY;

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to understand what you are

trying to tell me when trials come my way. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Those who mock the poor insult their maker, those who rejoice at the misfortune of others will be punished. (Proverbs 17:5)
reflection: Few facts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate, BUT many people do this because it makes them feel good to be better off or more successful than someone else. Mocking the poor is mocking God. who made them. We also ridicule God when we mock the weak, those who are different, or anyone else. When you catch yourself putting others down just for fun, stop and think about Who created them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I put my mouth in gear before thinking it was You who created them. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Those who mock the poor insult their maker, those who rejoice _

_at the misfortune of others will be punished. _(Pro. 17:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Few facts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate, BUT

many people do this because it makes them feel good to be

better off or more successful than someone else. Mocking the

poor is mocking God. who made them. We also ridicule God

when we mock the weak, those who are different, or anyone else.

When you catch yourself putting others down just for fun, stop

and think about Who created them.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I put my mouth in gear

before thinking it was You who created them. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: A bribe seems to work like magic for those who give it; they succeed in all they do. (PRO. 17:8)
reflection: Solomon is certainly not condoning bribery, but he is making an observation about the way the world operates. Bribes may get people what they want, but the Bible clearly condemns using them (Matthew 28:11-15)
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would always seek Your honest advise when I am tempted to do something that may cause me to sin. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A bribe seems to work like magic for those who give it; they_

_succeed in all they do__. _(PRO. 17:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon is certainly not condoning bribery, but he is making

an observation about the way the world operates. Bribes may

get people what they want, but the Bible clearly condemns

using them (Mt. 28:11-15)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always seek Your honest advise

when I am tempted to do something that may cause me to sin. .Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Disregarding another person's faults preserves love; telling about them separates close friends. (Proverbs 17:9)
reflection: This proverb is saying that we should be willing to disregard the faults of others. Covering over offenses is necessary to any relationship. It is tempting, especially in an argument, to bring up all the mistakes the other person has ever made. We should be careful to try not to bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to the topic being discussed. As we grow to be more like Christ, we will acquire God's ability to forget confessed sins of the past.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would have a more forgiving heart, so that I would become more Christ like each day. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Disregarding another person's faults preserves love;_

_telling about them separates close friends._ (Pro. 17:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This proverb is saying that we should be willing to

disregard the faults of others. Covering over offenses is

necessary to any relationship. It is tempting, especially

in an argument, to bring up all the mistakes the other

person has ever made. We should be careful to try not

to bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to

the topic being discussed. As we grow to be more like

Christ, we will acquire God's ability to forget confessed

sins of the past.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would have a more forgiving heart,

so that I would become more Christ like each day. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: A friend is always loyal; and a brother is born to help in time of need. (Proverbs 17:17)
reflection: What kind of friend are you? There is a vast difference between knowing someone well and being a true friend. The greatest evidence of genuine friendship is loyalty, being available to help in times of distress or personal struggle. To many people are fairweather friends. They stick around when the friendship helps THEM and leave when they are not getting anything out of the relationship. Be the kind of true friend the Bible encourages.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always be truly loyal to all my friends. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A friend is always loyal; and a brother is born to help_

_in time of need. _(Pro. 17:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What kind of friend are you? There is a vast difference between

knowing someone well and being a true friend. The greatest

evidence of genuine friendship is loyalty, being available to help

in times of distress or personal struggle. To many people are fairweather friends. They stick around when the friendship helps

THEM and leave when they are not getting anything out of the

relationship. Be the kind of true friend the Bible encourages.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always be truly loyal to

all my friends. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Anyone who loves to quarrel loves sin; anyone who speaks boastfully invites disaster. (Proverbs 17:19)
reflection: Good people enjoy the positive results of their words, BUT those who are treacherous seem to crave violence.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will always instill in me a positive attitude, always speaking well of others. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Anyone who loves to quarrel loves sin; anyone who speaks _

_boastfully __invites disaster. _(Pro. 17:19)

Good people enjoy the positive results of their words, BUT

those who are treacherous seem to crave violence.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will always instill in

me a positive attitude, always speaking well of others. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a broken spirit saps a person's strength. (Proverbs 17:22)
reflection: To be cheerful is to be ready to greet others with a welcome, a word of encouragement, an enthusiasm for the task at hand, and a positive out look on the future. Such people are as welcome, as pain-relieving medicine.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be ready to greet others with a word of encouragement, and a positive out look on the future. Forgive me when I'm lees then encouraging. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a broken spirit saps a_

_person's strength. _(Pro. 17:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

To be cheerful is to be ready to greet others with a welcome,

a word of encouragement, an enthusiasm for the task at hand,

and a positive out look on the future. Such people are as welcome,

as pain-relieving medicine.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be ready to greet others

with a word of encouragement, and a positive out look on the

future. Forgive me when I'm lees then encouraging. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Sensible people keep their eyes glued on wisdom, but a fool's wonder to the ends of the earth. (Proverbs 17:24)
reflection: There is something to be said about having dreams, Lord knows I have had my share, but this proverb points out the folly of chasing fantasies. I have found that it is better to align your goals with God's, being the kind of person He wants you to be! Take time to think about your dreams and goals, and make sure they cover the really important areas of life.
prayer: Lord, help me to tackle everything on my plate today with grace, and enthusiasm, knowing that my attitude may effect others in ways I'm not even aware of. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Sensible people keep their eyes glued on wisdom, but a fool's_

_wonder to the ends of the earth. _(Pro. 17:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

There is something to be said about having dreams, Lord knows

I have had my share, but this proverb points out the folly of

chasing fantasies. I have found that it is better to align your

goals with God's, being the kind of person He wants you to be!

Take time to think about your dreams and goals, and make sure

they cover the really important areas of life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Lord, help me to tackle everything on my plate today with grace,

and enthusiasm, knowing that my attitude may effect others in

ways I'm not even aware of. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Even fools are thought to be wise when they keep silent; when they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent. (Proverbs 17:28)
reflection: When we talk to much and listen to little we communicate to others that we think our ideas are much more important then theirs. The Bible advice's us to reverse this process. When we find ourselves acting out this in our lives we need to put a stopwatch on our conversations, and keep track of how much we talk and how much we listen.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a better listener. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Even fools are thought to be wise when they keep silent;_

_when they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent._

THOUGHT FOR TODAY;

_When we talk to much and listen to little we communicate to_

_others that we think our ideas are much more important then_

_theirs. The Bible advices us to reverse this process. When we_

_find ourselves acting out this in our lives we need to put a_

_stop-watch on our conversations, and keep track of how much _

_we talk and how much we listen._

_PRAYER FOR TODAY:_

_Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a better listener. Amen. _

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Fools have very little interest in understanding; they only want to air their own opinions. (Proverbs 18:2)
reflection: The Lord approves of those who are good, but He condemns those who have evil plans. only the godly have deep roots.
prayer: Dear Heavenly, I pray that I will not fall under Your condemnation Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Fools have very little interest in understanding; they only want _

_to air their own opinions. _ (Pro. 18:2_)_

The Lord approves of those who are good, but He condemns

those who have evil plans. only the godly have deep roots.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly, I pray that I will not fall under Your condemnation

Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: People ruin their lives by their own foolishness and then become angry at the Lord. (Proverbs 19:3
reflection: People continually blame God for their self-induced problems. How do you handle unpleasant results of your own choices? Where do you fix the blame? Instead of blaming God, look for ways to grow through your bad choices and failures.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, please forgive me for making my own plans, and when they fail I have the tendency to blame You. Help me to always look to You for wisdom. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_People ruin their lives by their own foolishness and then become_

_ angry at the Lord. _(Pro. 19:3

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

People continually blame God for their self-induced problems.

How do you handle unpleasant results of your own choices?

Where do you fix the blame? Instead of blaming God, look for

ways to grow through your bad choices and failures.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, please forgive me for making my own

plans, and when they fail I have the tendency to blame You.

Help me to always look to You for wisdom. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: A false witness will not go unpunished, nor will a liar escape. (Proverbs 19:5)
reflection: Making up false stories is strictly forbidden by the Lord. Gossip, slander, and false witnessing undermines families, strains neighborhood cooperation, and causes chaos of a justice system. Yes destructive gossip will always cause problems. Even if you do not initiate a lie, you become responsible if you pass it along. The best advice is don't circulate rumors; squelch them before they get started.
prayer: I thank You Lord, for the many blessings You have given since the creation of the world, even though we are far from deserving of even one. I pray that You would open the eyes of us all so that we may turn our lives back over to You. Help us to be faithful I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A false witness will not go unpunished, nor will a liar_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Making up false stories is strictly forbidden by the Lord.

Gossip, slander, and false witnessing undermines families,

strains neighborhood cooperation, and causes chaos of a

justice system. Yes destructive gossip will always cause

problems. Even if you do not initiate a lie, you become

responsible if you pass it along. The best advice is don't

circulate rumors; squelch them before they get started.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for the many blessings You have given

since the creation of the world, even though we are far from

deserving of even one. I pray that You would open the eyes of

us all so that we may turn our lives back over to You. Help

us to be faithful I pray in Jesus name. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: People with good sense restrain their anger; they earn esteem by overlooking wrongs. (Proverbs 19:11)
reflection: A quick temper can be like a fire out of control. It can burn us and everyone else in its path. Anger divides people. It pushes us into hasty decisions that only causes bitterness and guilt. Yet anger, in itself, is not wrong. Anger can be a legitimate reaction to injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look for the cause. Are you reacting to an evil situation that you are going to set right? Or are you responding to a personal insult?
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I pray that You will help me control a quick temper, channel my feelings into effective action so that I may conquer selfish anger through humility and repentance. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_People with good sense restrain their anger; they earn_

_esteem by overlooking wrongs. _(Pro. 19:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A quick temper can be like a fire out of control. It can burn us

and everyone else in its path. Anger divides people. It pushes

us into hasty decisions that only causes bitterness and guilt. Yet

anger, in itself, is not wrong. Anger can be a legitimate reaction

to injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look

for the cause. Are you reacting to an evil situation that you are

going to set right? Or are you responding to a personal insult?

PRAY FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that You will help me control a

quick temper, channel my feelings into effective action so that

I may conquer selfish anger through humility and repentance.

Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Keep the commandments and keep your life; despising them leads to death. (Proverbs 19:16)
reflection: The commandments we are told to obey are those in God's Word, such as the Ten Commandments (Exodus, 20) and other passages of instruction. To obey what God teaches in the Bible is self-preserving. to disobey is self-destructive.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance so that I may always keep Your commandments and Your other instructions. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Keep the commandments and keep your life; despising_

_them leads to death. _(Pro. 19:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The commandments we are told to obey are those in God's

Word, such as the Ten Commandments (Ex, 20) and other

passages of instruction. To obey what God teaches in the

Bible is self-preserving. to disobey is self-destructive.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance

so that I may always keep Your commandments and Your other

instructions. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If you help the poor, you are lending to the Lord, and He will repay you. (Proverbs 19:17)
reflection: Here God identifies with the poor as Jesus does in (Matthew 25:31-46). As our Creator, God values all of us, whether we are poor or rich. When we help the poor, we horror both the Creator and His creation. God accepts our help as if we had offered it directly to Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to look upon all people equally. Help me to reach out to all in need no matter what their status may be. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If you help the poor, you are lending to the Lord,_

_and He will repay you. _(Pro 19:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Here God identifies with the poor as Jesus does in (Mt. 25:31-46).

As our Creator, God values all of us, whether we are poor or rich.

When we help the poor, we horror both the Creator and His creation.

God accepts our help as if we had offered it directly to Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to look upon all people equally.

Help me to reach out to all in need no matter what their status

may be. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You can make many plans, but the Lord's purpose will prevail. (Proverbs 19:21)
reflection: Are you frustrated with the inconsistencies of other or even in yourself? God is completely trustworthy, His intentions never change. There is a promise that what ever is good and perfect comes to us from the Creator who never changes (James 1:17). When you wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember that God is completely consistent. We need to let Him counsel us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I know in my heart that You are trustworthy but there are times I need to be reminded, because in my human nature I become impatient and run out ahead of You. Forgive me for my sins. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_You can make many plans, but the Lord's purpose will prevail._

(Pro. 19:21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Are you frustrated with the inconsistencies of other or even in

yourself? God is completely trustworthy, His intensions never

change. There is a promise that what ever is good and perfect

comes to us from the Creator who never changes (Jm. 1:17).

When you wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember

that God is completely consistent. We need to let Him counsel

us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I know in my heart that You are trustworthy

but there are times I need to be reminded, because in my human

nature I become impatient and run out ahead of You. Forgive me

for my sins. AMEN.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If you punish a mocker, the simpleminded will learn a lesson, if you reprove the wise, the will be all the smarter. (Proverbs 19:25)
reflection: There is a great difference between the person who learns from criticism and the person who refuses to accept correction. How we respond to criticism determines whether or not we grow in wisdom. The next time someone criticizes you, listen carefully to all that is said. You might learn something.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always accept constructive criticism. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If you punish a mocker, the simpleminded will learn a lesson,_

_if you reprove the wise, the will be all the smarter._ (Pro. 19:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

There is a great difference between the person who learns from

criticism and the person who refuses to accept correction. How

we respond to criticism determines whether or not we grow in

wisdom. The next time someone criticizes you, listen carefully

to all that is said. You might learn something.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always accept constructive

criticism. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Mockers will be punished, and the backs of fools will be beaten. (Proverbs 19:29)
reflection: Wrong assumptions lead to wrong conclusions. We should not take our limited experiences and jump to conclusions about life in general. If you find yourself doubting God, remember that you do not have all the facts. God wants only the very best for your life. Many people endure great pain, but ultimately they find some greater good from it. When you're struggling, don't assume the worst.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that You will forgive me when I jump to conclusions about people and different situations in life. I pray that I will always trust in Your advise. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Mockers will be punished, and the backs of fools will be beaten._

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Wrong assumptions lead to wrong conclusions. We should not

take our limited experiences and jump to conclusions about life

in general. If you find yourself doubting God, remember that you

do not have all the facts. God wants only the very best for your

life. Many people endure great pain, but ultimately they find some

greater good from it. When you're struggling, don't assume the worst.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that You will forgive me when I jump to conclusions

about people and different situations in life. I pray that I will
always

trust in Your advise. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Who can say, "I have cleansed my heart; I am pure and free from sin. (Proverbs 20:9)
reflection: No one is without sin. As soon as we confess our sins and repent, sinful thoughts and actions begin to creep back into our life. We all need ongoing cleansing. We need to thank God that He is a merciful God who provides forgiveness by His mercy when we ask for it. We need to make confession and repentance a regular part of our talks with God. We need to rely on Him for the cleansing we need.
prayer: I thank You Lord for the assurance we have that You hear our confessions and that You promise to forgive us when we repent of our sins. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Who can say, "I have cleansed my heart; I am pure and free _

_from sin. _(Pro. 20:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

No one is without sin. As soon as we confess our sins and repent,

sinful thoughts and actions begin to creep back into our life. We

all need ongoing cleansing. We need to thank God that He is a

merciful God who provides forgiveness by His mercy when we

ask for it. We need to make confession and repentance a regular

part of our talks with God. We need to rely on Him for the cleansing

we need.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord for the assurance we have that You hear our

confessions and that You promise to forgive us when we repent

of our sins. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: How can we understand the road we travel? It is the Lord who directs our steps. (Proverbs 20:24)
reflection: We are often confused by the events around us. Some things we will never understand until years later when we look back and see how God was working. Scriptures tell us we should not worry if we don't understand every thing as it happens. Instead, we should trust that God knows what He is doing even if His timing or design is not clear to us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not always following your leading. Help me to be more trusting even when I don't understand Your plans for us. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

How can we understand the road we travel? It is the
Lord who directs our steps. (Pro. 20:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are often confused by the events around us. Some things

we will never understand until years later when we look back

and see how God was working. Scriptures tell us we should

not worry if we don't understand every thing as it happens.

Instead, we should trust that God knows what He is doing

even if His timing or design is not clear to us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not always following your

leading. Help me to be more trusting even when I don't understand

Your plans for us. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is dangerous to make a rash promise to God before counting the cost. (Proverbs 20:25)
reflection: God takes vows very seriously and requires that they are carried out (Deuteronomy 23:21-23). We often have good intentions when making a vow because we want to please God. Jesus, however, says it is better not to make promises to God because He knows how difficult they are to keep (Matthew 5:33-37).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me for the promises I have made and failed to keep. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is dangerous to make a rash promise to God before_

_counting the cost. _(Pro. 2o:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God takes vows very seriously and requires that they are

carried out (Deut. 23:21-23). We often have good intentions

when making a vow because we want to please God. Jesus,

however, says it is better not to make promises to God

because He knows how difficult they are to keep (Mt. 5:33-37).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me for the
promises

I have made and failed to keep. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord, searching all his innermost parts. (Proverbs 20:27)
reflection: SPIRIT "The breath of life" God breathed into Adams nostrils distinguishing humankind from all other creatures (Genesis 2:7). It penetrates, and energizes every human faculty. God judges the heart and knows who are His. It is a terrible prospect for God to look at our hearts, considering what lies within.
prayer: Dear Lord, I realize that You know my heart, and I confess that my heart is NOT always pleasing to You. Please forgive me for the uncleanliness that dwells within my heart. Amen.
original_content:

_The spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord, searching all_

distinguishing humankind from all other creatures (Gen. 2:7).

It penetrates, and energizes every human faculty. God judges

the heart and knows who are His. It is a terrible prospect for

God to look at our hearts, considering what lies within.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I realize that You know my heart, and I confess

that my heart is NOT always pleasing to You. Please forgive

me for the uncleanliness that dwells within my heart. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Blows that wound cleanse away evil; stokes make clean the innermost parts. (Proverbs 20:30)
reflection: Our heavenly Father, disciplines those He loves, WHY? Because we are all born sinful. That is why we should not be surprised by our ill manners. God's dear Son became human for our sakes pierced and lashed to rescue us from sin and to deliver us into the arms of our Heavenly Father.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that You provided a way for man to inherit eternal life by faith in Your Son Jesus Christ. I pray for forgiveness of all my sins. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Blows that wound cleanse away evil; stokes make clean the _

_innermost parts. _(Pro. 20:30)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our heavenly Father, disciplines those He loves, WHY? Because

we are all born sinful. That is why we should not be surprised by

our ill manners. God's dear Son became human for our sakes

pierced and lashed to rescue us from sin and to deliver us into

the arms of our Heavenly Father.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that You provided a way

for man to inherit eternal life by faith in Your Son Jesus Christ.

I pray for forgiveness of all my sins. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifices. (Proverbs 21:3)
reflection: Outward ceremonies as such are not useless, sacrificial offerings of various kinds were required by the Law of Moses. We lay on God's alter the sacrifice of self-will and the offering of wholehearted consecration. True worship DOES NOT begin with giving to God but the receiving in humble faith. Then we need to live in fervent love one to another, especially toward those in need.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to have a fervent love for others, giving of myself in the likeness of Christ, especially to the needy. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the_

_Lord than sacrifices. _(Pro. 21:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Outward ceremonies as such are not useless, sacrificial offerings

of various kinds were required by the Law of Moses. We lay on

God's alter the sacrifice of self-will and the offering of wholeheated consecration. True worship DOES NOT begin with giving

to God but the receiving in humble faith. Then we need to live

in fervent love one to another, especially toward those in need.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, help me to have a fervent love for others, giving of

myself in the likeness of Christ, especially to the needy. .Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The violence of the wicked will sweep them away; because they refuse to do what is just (Proverbs 21:7)
reflection: Those who have left the right path for the way of evil, come to enjoy the way they have chosen. Through the effective working of the DEVIL, what repulses at first becomes interesting, then acceptable, and finally a source of sinful delight.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remain faithful in the reading and studying of Your Word so that I may receive Your grace through Your Son our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The violence of the wicked will sweep them away;_

_because they refuse to do what is just_ (Pro. 21:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Those who have left the right path for the way of evil,

come to enjoy the way they have chosen. Through the

effective working of the DEVIL, what repulses at first

becomes interesting, then acceptable, and finally a

source of sinful delight.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remain faithful in the

reading and studying of Your Word so that I may receive

Your grace through Your Son our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When a scoffer is punished, the simple become wise; when a wise man is instructed, he gains knowledge. (Proverbs 21:11) THOUGHT FOR TODAY. "SCOFFER" is someone who stubbornly scorns God's wisdom, "THE SIMPLE WILL LEARN PRUDENCE. " Punishment is a deterrent for the simple who take warning from the fate of the wicked. Simple people must actually see what consequences come from disobedience. this is an indictment to us all, we may know well enough that lawlessness has its price, but we change our behavior ONLY when the treat of punishment is near.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I don't have to be hit in the head to realize that there are consequences for those whose behavior is not in tune with Your will. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_When a scoffer is punished, the simple become wise; when a_

_wise man is instructed, he gains knowledge. _(Pro. 21:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY.

_"SCOFFER" is someone who stubbornly scorns God's wisdom, _

_"THE SIMPLE WILL LEARN PRUDENCE." _Punishment is a deterrent

for the simple who take warning from the fate of the wicked.

Simple people must actually see what consequences come from

disobedience. this is an indictment to us all, we may know well

enough that lawlessness has its price, but we change our behavior

ONLY when the treat of punishment is near.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I don't have to be hit in the

head to realize that there are consequences for those whose

behavior is not in tune with Your will. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: A gift in secret averts anger, and a concealed bribe, strong wrath. (Proverbs 21:14)
reflection: "CONCEALED BRIBE" does not endorse bribery, but points out the effectiveness of worldly and sinful methods, which God's people should not encourage (Romans 12:1-2). Which is worth reading.
prayer: Thank You Heavenly Father, for Your mercies in Jesus Christ and for the transforming work, You began in my Baptism. Empower me by Your Spirit to present my body as a living sacrifice of worship acceptable to You in Jesus Christ. Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A gift in secret averts anger, and a concealed bribe, strong_

_wrath_. (Pro. 21:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"CONCEALED BRIBE" _does not endorse bribery, but points out

the effectiveness of worldly and sinful methods, which God's

people should not encourage (Ro. 12:1-2). Which is worth

reading.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Heavenly Father, for Your mercies in Jesus Christ

and for the transforming work, You began in my Baptism.

Empower me by Your Spirit to present my body as a living

sacrifice of worship acceptable to You in Jesus Christ. Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more when he brings it with evil intent. (Proverbs 21:27)
reflection: Without faith it is impossible to please God. "Only justified people, who are led by the Spirit of Christ can do go works. Without faith in Christ as Mediator, good works do not please. Saving faith both in God's existence and in His mercy for Christ's sake is the secret to pleasing God.
prayer: Lord Jesus, save me from my sin, which clings so closely, and give me endurance to do Your will. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more_

_when he brings it with evil intent. _(Pro. 21:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Without faith it is impossible to please God. "Only justified people,

who are led by the Spirit of Christ can do go works. Without faith in

Christ as Mediator, good works do not please. Saving faith both in

God's existence and in His mercy for Christ's sake is the secret to

pleasing God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Lord Jesus, save me from my sin, which clings so closely, and give

me endurance to do Your will. Amen.
